references.paper_title: Instrumental variables estimates of the effect of subsidized training on the quantiles of trainee earnings
references.reason: This paper is foundational for the use of quantile treatment effects in causal inference, providing a method to estimate the effect of a treatment on multiple quantiles of the outcome distribution.

references.paper_title: Simple and bias-corrected matching estimators for average treatment effects
references.reason: This paper introduces improved matching estimators for average treatment effects, addressing bias and improving the accuracy of causal effect estimation.
This paper introduces generalized random forests, a flexible machine learning method widely used for causal inference and heterogeneous treatment effect estimation.

references.paper_title: Robust and agnostic learning of conditional distributional treatment effects
references.reason: This paper extends double robustness to the estimation of conditional quantile treatment effects, improving the accuracy and reliability of causal inference in complex settings.

references.paper_title: Towards optimal doubly robust estimation of heterogeneous causal effects
references.reason: This paper develops a novel doubly robust estimation procedure for heterogeneous treatment effects, improving efficiency and robustness to model misspecification.
